title: Basketball Wives' Evelyn Lozada files for a restraining order against castmate Ogom 'OG' Chijindu
text:
Basketball Wives star Evelyn Lozada's feud with co-star Ogom 'OG' Chijindu is getting serious.

Lozada has filed documents to keep Chijindu at a distance, but a judge has yet to rule on the matter according to TMZ.

Lozada and Chijindu are already embroiled in a legal dispute. Evelyn is currently suing for defamation over OG calling her a 'racist bigot' on social media back in September.

At odds: Basketball Wives' Evelyn Lozada has filed documents to keep co-star Ogum 'OG' Chijindu at a distance, but a judge has yet to rule on the matter

In addition to defamation, Evelyn also filed for intentional infliction of emotional distress after OG accused her of being racist for using a monkey emoji on Instagram.

She claims that Chijindu's words directly affected her career and she 'sustained serious financial harm through loss of income as well as serious and permanent injuries,' according to The Blast.

'Nobody watches you harder than the people that can't stand you,' Evelyn wrote earlier this month, followed by a laughing orangutan GIF.

OG took offense to the post, specifically the ape, and took to social media where she shared her own words across the message.

'Wow so now black women are monkeys,' she wrote. 'Everyone boycott this trash box ... you are disgusting.'

'Wow so now black women are monkeys,' she wrote. 'Everyone boycott this trash box ... you are disgusting.'

'And there it is.. show your true colors you racist bigot,' she wrote. 'You called Cece "Ling Ling" Jackie a 'cockroach' & now me a 'monkey.' May God take care of you well well..Evelyn Lozada'

In a tweet to her 33,000 followers on Twitter, Chijindu continued her verbal tirade against Lozada.

'And there it is.. show your true colors you racist bigot,' she wrote. 'You called Cece "Ling Ling" Jackie a 'cockroach' & now me a 'monkey.' May God take care of you well well..Evelyn Lozada.'

She also made sure to tag the VH1 network when finishing her thoughts with 'not ok.'

Not great: Lozada came under fire in 2018 for some choice words about co-star CeCe Guiterrez who is of Filipino descent

Lozada came under fire in 2018 for some choice words about co-star CeCe Guiterrez who is of Filipino descent.

She noted in court documents that her two children are of African descent in addition to their Hispanic side from her family.

Evelyn also made note that she does an impressive amount of charity work through her self-named foundation which raises money for domestic violence victims.
